item.title: scott add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "chaos: it has no plural." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: scott add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "Incredible the animal that first dreamed of another animal." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: scott add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "The novel is the privileged vehicle of two ways of being: narrative and freedom: to be new (novel) in a speech open to all, and to be free in a speech that never concludes." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: scott add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "Robinson Crusoe, the first capitalist hero, is a self-made man who accepts objective reality and then fashions it to his needs through the work ethic, common sense, resilience, technology, and, if need be, racism and imperialism." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: scott add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "The contract between the author and the reader is a game. And the game . . . is one of the greatest invetions of Western civilization: the game of telling stories, inventing characters, and creating the imaginary paradise of the individual, from whence no one can be expelled because, in a novel, no one owns the truth and everyone has the right to be heard and understood." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: scott add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "But what do I have? The things I'm told and the things I tell, that's all. And as far as I know, that never yet made anyone fly." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: scott add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "Memory is a snare, pure and simple; it alters, it subtly rearranges the past to fit the present." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: scott add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "One can't fight with oneself, for this battle has only one loser." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: scott add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "It is rare and almost impossible for a novel to have only one narrator." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: scott add a quote by Sara Castro-Klarén
item.description: "It is as if Little Red Riding Hood had asked the wolf: "Dear Grandmother, what is the truth for?" And the wolf had replied: "The truth helps me tell you better lies." -- Sara Castro-Klarén

item.title: scott add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: scott add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Love is an attempt to penetrate another being, but it can only be realized if the surrender is mutual." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: scott add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Ser uno mismo es, siempre, llegar a ser ese otro que somos y que llevamos escondido en nuestro interior, más que nada como promesa o posibilidad de ser." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: scott add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Una civilización que niega a la muerte, acaba por negar a la vida." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: scott add a quote by Pramoedya Ananta Toer
item.description: "How simple life is. It's as simple as this: you're hungry and you eat, you're full and you shit. Between eating and shitting, that's where human life is found. - (Houseboy + Maid, in Tales from Djakarta)" -- Pramoedya Ananta Toer

item.title: scott add a quote by Ernest Renan
item.description: "O Lord, if there is a Lord, save my soul, if I have a soul... " -- Ernest Renan

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Whatever one man does, it is as if all men did it. For that reason, it is not unfair that one disobedience in a garden should contaminate all humanity; for that reason it is not unjust that the crucifixion of a single Jew should be sufficient to save it." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Life itself is a quotation." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Siempre imaginé que el Paraíso sería algún tipo de biblioteca." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Heaven and hell seem out of proportion to me: the actions of men do not deserve so much." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Besides, rereading, not reading, is what counts." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "No one is anyone, one single immortal man is all men. Like Cornelius Agrippa, I am god, I am hero, I am philosopher, I am demon and I am world, which is a tedious way of saying that I do not exist." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Being with you and not being with you is the only way I have to measure time." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "La literatura no es otra cosa que un sueño dirigido." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Estoy solo y no hay nadie en el espejo." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "He consorted with prostitutes and poets...and with persons even worse." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Tres suertes puede correr un libro de versos: puede ser adjudicado al olvido, puedo no dejar una sola línea pero sí una imagen total del hombre que lo hizo, puede legar a las antologías unos pocos poemas..." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let not the rash marble risk garrulous breaches of oblivion's omnipotence, in many words recalling name, renown, events, birthplace. All those glass jewels are best left in the dark. Let not the marble say what men do not. The essentials of the dead man's life-- the trembling hope, the implacable miracle of pain, the wonder of sensual delight-- will abide forever. Blindly the uncertain soul asks to continue when it is the lives of others that will make that happen, as you yourself are the mirror and image of those who did not live as long as you and others will be (and are) your immortality on earth." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: scott add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "We did meet forty years ago. At that time we were both influenced by Whitman and I said, jokingly in part, 'I don't think anything can be done in Spanish, do you?' Neruda agreed, but we decided it was too late for us to write our verse in English. We'd have to make the best of a second-rate literature." -- Jorge Luis Borges
